column4: What frustrates me about X is they keep moving the location of the xorg.conf file in Ubuntu Linux, it's not in /etc/X11 now it's in /usr/lib/X11
I have this file  xorg.conf.d  in my /usr/lib/X11 I dont know what it does
thats a directory
okay
When I look in the directory cd /usr/lib/X11/xorg.conf.d/ this is what I have now 05-evdev.conf  10-synaptics.conf  10-vmmouse.conf  10-wacom.conf
same here. No worries
What happened to the old xorg.conf file ?
still in same place. But you might not have one at all.
I used to use the Linux generated version of an xorg.conf file to use it on FreeBSD but I cannot do that anymore for my computer
just create one
Ubuntu Linux uses something different to produce an X configuration file for all computers
I ran X -configure on FreeBSD and the screen doesnt pop up like in Ubuntu Linux
does this help. http://www.freebsd.org/doc/handbook/x-config.html
Fatal server error:
Server is already active for display 0
If this server is no longer running, remove /tmp/.X0-lock
and start again.
Please consult the The X.Org Foundation support
at http://wiki.x.org
this IRC is for ubuntu though so I cant help as I dont know freebsd
They keep moving the X Configuration files around in Ubuntu Linux Files ending in *.conf in the /usr/lib/X11/xorg.conf.d/ directory (NOTE: will be changed to /usr/share/X11/xorg.conf.d for 10.10
sipherdee, yes now I have to piece all the files in /usr/lib/xorg.conf.d into one xorg.conf file for FreeBSD to use X on my machine
You might get better help here. http://forums.freebsd.org/
